name: SSF5
title: Site-Specific Factor 5
subtitle: Chromosome 1p: Loss of Heterozygosity (LOH)
notes:
**Note 1:**  This is a special molecular diagnostic test performed on tumor tissue to identify loss of genetic material normally found on the short arm of one of the patient's two copies of chromosome 1.  A normal cell will contain two complete copies of each chromosome, one from each parent, and this normal state is termed heterozygous.  Loss of heterozygosity (LOH) is an abnormal state reflecting damage to the chromosome.

**Note 2:**  Other terms for LOH include gene deletion and allelic loss.

**Note 3:** For brain tumors, tests for LOH of chromosomes 1p and 19q may be performed at the same time and reported on a single report. See also Site-Specific Factor 6.
rows: Test positive for loss of heterozygosity (LOH)
Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
